Class AuthService

java.lang.Object
com.FeedEmGreens.HealthyAura.service.AuthService
@Service public class AuthService extends Object
Service layer handling authentication and user account management logic for the HealthyAura application.

This class encapsulates the core business rules for:

  • User registration (for both standard users and administrators)
  • Credential validation and login authentication
  • JWT token generation for secure client sessions
  • Automatic initialization of a Points record upon signup

By separating this logic from the controller, the service promotes a clean architecture following the Serviceâ€“Repository pattern, where each component focuses on a single responsibility.

Since:
2025-11-07

  • Method Details

    • signup

      public Users signup(String email, String username, String rawPassword, String role)
      Registers a new standard user in the system.

      This method:

      1. Validates that the username and email are unique.
      2. Encodes the password using BCryptPasswordEncoder.
      3. Persists the new Users entity.
      4. Creates and associates a Points record initialized with 0 points.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the new user
      username - the unique username of the user
      rawPassword - the plain-text password (to be encoded)
      role - the user role (typically "USER")
      Returns:
      the newly registered Users entity
      Throws:
      AuthService.DuplicateUserException - if username or email already exists

    • createAdmin

      public Users createAdmin(String email, String username, String rawPassword, String role)
      Registers a new administrator account.

      Similar to signup(String, String, String, String), but sets the role as "ADMIN" instead of "USER". The method also initializes an empty Points record for the admin user.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the admin
      username - the desired admin username
      rawPassword - the plain-text password
      role - the user role (typically "ADMIN")
      Returns:
      the newly created admin Users entity
      Throws:
      AuthService.DuplicateUserException - if username or email already exists

    • login

      public AuthResponse login(String username, String rawPassword)
      Authenticates a user and generates a JWT token upon successful login.

      The method performs:

      • Username lookup in the database
      • Password verification using BCrypt
      • JWT generation with embedded username and role claims

      Console logging is used to trace authentication flow during development.

      Parameters:
      username - the username provided by the client
      rawPassword - the password entered during login
      Returns:
      an AuthResponse containing the JWT token and user details
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the username does not exist or the password is invalid
